markdown:
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 86, 655, 106]]<|/det|>
e) Wir betrachten eine ODE und zwei Funktionen, nämlich 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[350, 117, 740, 139]]<|/det|>
\[y'y = 1; \quad y_1(x) = \sqrt{2x}, \quad y_2(x) = \sqrt{2x - 3}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[152, 151, 220, 170]]<|/det|>
Es gilt 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[236, 179, 856, 219]]<|/det|>
\[y_1'(x) = 2 \cdot \frac{1}{2 \cdot \sqrt{2x}} = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2x}} \quad \text{und} \quad y_2'(x) = 2 \cdot \frac{1}{2 \cdot \sqrt{3x - 3}} = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2x - 3}}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[152, 230, 250, 247]]<|/det|>
und somit 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[185, 256, 870, 295]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{y_1'(x) \cdot y_1(x)}{\sqrt{2x}} = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2x}} \cdot \sqrt{2x} = \frac{1}{2} \quad \text{und} \quad \frac{y_2'(x) \cdot y_2(x)}{\sqrt{2x - 3}} = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2x - 3}} \cdot \sqrt{2x - 3} = \frac{1}{2}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 308, 632, 327]]<|/det|>
f) Wir betrachten eine ODE und eine Funktion, nämlich 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[342, 338, 750, 375]]<|/det|>
\[(1 + y^2) + (1 + x^2) \cdot y' = 0; \quad y(x) = \frac{k - x}{1 + kx}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[152, 384, 664, 404]]<|/det|>
Durch Ableiten mit Hilfe der Quotienten-Regel finden wir 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[152, 414, 872, 456]]<|/det|>
\[y'(x) = \frac{(0 - 1) \cdot (1 + kx) - (k - x) \cdot (0 + k)}{(1 + kx)^2} = \frac{-1 - kx - k^2 + xk}{(1 + kx)^2} = -\frac{1 + k^2}{(1 + kx)^2}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[152, 466, 250, 484]]<|/det|>
Somit gilt 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[152, 494, 857, 740]]<|/det|>
\[\begin{align*}
D &= \frac{(1 + y^2(x)) + (1 + x^2) \cdot y'(x)}{1 + kx} = 1 + \left(\frac{k - x}{1 + kx}\right)^2 + (1 + x^2) \cdot \left(-\frac{1 + k^2}{(1 + kx)^2}\right) \\
&= \frac{(1 + kx)^2}{(1 + kx)^2} + \frac{(k - x)^2}{(1 + kx)^2} - \frac{(1 + x^2) \cdot (1 + k^2)}{(1 + kx)^2} \\
&= \frac{(1 + kx)^2 + (k - x)^2 - (1 + x^2) \cdot (1 + k^2)}{(1 + k x)^2} \\
&= \frac{1 + 2kx + k^2x^2 + k^2 - 2kx + x^2 - (1 + x^2 + k^2 + x^2k^2)}{(1 + kx)^2} \\
&= \frac{1 + k^2x^2 + k^2 + x^2 - 1 - x^2 - k^2 - x^2k^2}{(1 + kx)^2} = \frac{0}{(1 + kx)^2} = \frac{0}{1 + kx} = \frac{0}{1 + kx} = \frac{0}{1}.
\end{align*}\]
